items.title: Making a Difference
items.skills: Producer, Video Editor & Motion Graphics Artist
items.desc: Young Audiences Arts for Learning (YA) is the nation’s largest arts-in-education learning network, serving more than 5 million kids each year in more than 7 thousand schools and community centers across the country. Video content distributed across their social media network promoted organization’s brand, programming, policies and practices.
items.caption: Making a Difference

items.title: Power Play
items.skills: Producer, Video Editor & Motion Graphics Artist
items.desc: The Rubin’s Annual Summer Block Party, attended by thousands of New Yorkers, was one of its biggest events. The museum offered free admission to its air-conditioned exhibits while outdoor events featured art and activities inspired by the Rubin’s yearlong exploration of the power that dwells within us and flows between us.
items.caption: Power Play

items.title: Clapping with Stones
items.skills: Producer, Video Editor & Motion Graphics Artist
items.desc: Clapping with Stones: Art and Acts of Resistance used the Rubin’s circular architecture to create a unique and immersive display of photography, sculpture, video, textile and installation. Curated by Sara Raza, the exhibition examined social, cultural and political events through the local and global perspectives of artists Lida Abdul, Kader Attia, Nadia Kaabi-Linke, Naiza Khan, Kimsooja, Pallavi Paul, Shahpour Pouyan, Ibrahim Quraishi, Nari Ward and Hank Willis Thomas.
items.caption: Clapping with Stones

items.title: Brainwave Series
items.desc: Neuroscientist and New York Times bestselling Author David Eagleman joined the Rubin as the first Brainwave Fellow, curating a series of talks, films and experiences to explore time’s impact on our brains, everyday life and perception of the future.
items.caption: Brainwave Series

items.title: Compassionate Action
items.skills: Producer, Videographer, Video Editor & Motion Graphics Artist
items.desc: Meditation teacher, facilitator and writer Kate Johnson hosted a series of interactive evenings including conversations, meditation and activities with artists, changemakers, cultural creators and healers who leverage the power of spirit to fuel their transformative work around the world.
items.caption: Compassionate Action

items.title: Power Trip
items.desc: This fundraising event took the form of an artful fete, filling every inch of the Rubin with performances, experiences, flavors and sensations to inspire donors to participate in an exciting power disruption and spark conversation.
items.caption: Power Trip
